text: A cup contains 250 g of water.  Find the total positive charge present in the cup of water.
hint: Mass of water = 250 g Molecular mass of water = 18 g Number of molecules in 18 g of water = 6.02 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>23</mn></msup></math> Number of molecules in one cup of water =  <math display="block"> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mn>5</mn> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>×</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo>.</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>2</mn> <mo>×</mo> <mn>1</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math> Each molecule of water contains two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom, i.e., 10 electrons and 10 protons. [F05C] Total positive charge present in one cup of water  <math display="block"> <mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mn>5</mn> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>×</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo>.</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>2</mn> <mo>×</mo> <mn>1</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mo>×</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>0</mn> <mo>×</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo>.</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo>×</mo> <mn>1</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>9</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mi>C</mi> </mrow> </math> = 1.34 × <math><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>7</mn></msup></math>C
